message.content:
1. An investigation was conducted on the incidence of inter- and post-operative shivering in patients.
2. The investigation involved three groups of patients.
3. The three groups were divided based on the dosage of hydrocortisone they received: 1 mg/kg, 2 mg/kg, or a placebo.
4. Within the study period, 31 patients suffered from shivering.
5. Among the 31 patients, 9 cases were in the 1 mg/kg hydrocortisone group.
6. Among the 31 patients, 5 cases were in the 2 mg/kg hydrocortisone group.
7. Among the 31 patients, 17 cases were in the placebo group.
8. The Chi-square test was used to analyze the data.
9. The difference in the incidence of shivering among the three groups was found to be significant.
10. The P-value of the test was 0.004.

messages.content:
Statement: The investigation of the incidence of inter- and post-operative shivering in patients in the three groups revealed that within the study period, 31 patients suffered from shivering among which 9, 5, and 17 cases were in 1 mg/kg hydrocortisone group, 2 mg/kg hydrocortisone group, and placebo group, respectively, and according to the Chi-square test, the difference among the three groups was significant (P = 0.004).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
